skill.name: error-handling
skill.description:
Use when implementing structured error handling in backend or frontend code.
Triggers for: try-catch patterns, custom exception classes, global error handlers,
error logging, user-friendly error messages, or API error responses.
NOT for: business logic validation (use domain exceptions) or unrelated error types.

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation and a validation script. The verify.py script reads SKILL.md to validate format requirements. No network calls, no file modifications, no external commands, no sensitive data access. Behavior matches stated purpose.

content.value_statement: Applications need consistent error messages for users and detailed logs for developers. This skill provides ready-to-use exception classes, logging patterns, and error handlers for FastAPI backends and React frontends.
actual_capabilities: Create custom exception classes with user-friendly and internal messages
Implement global error handlers for FastAPI applications
Build frontend error boundaries and API response mappers for React
Add structured JSON logging with correlation IDs
Handle authentication, validation, and rate limit errors consistently
Separate technical details from user-facing error messages
limitations: Does not include business logic validation patterns
Does not cover error monitoring service integration
Does not provide pre-built error tracking with Sentry or similar tools
Does not include migration error handling for database changes

use_cases.title: Build consistent API errors
use_cases.description: Create exception hierarchies with proper HTTP status codes and user-friendly messages for FastAPI endpoints.

use_cases.title: Handle API failures gracefully
use_cases.description: Map API error responses to user-friendly messages with React error boundaries and toast notifications.

use_cases.title: Connect frontend to backend errors
use_cases.description: Implement matching error patterns on both ends with structured logging for debugging across services.

prompt_templates.title: Basic exception class
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a custom NotFoundError exception class that extends AppException with 404 status code. Include user message and internal detail fields.

prompt_templates.title: Global error handler
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up a global exception handler in FastAPI that catches AppException and returns consistent JSON error format with correlation ID logging.

prompt_templates.title: Frontend error boundary
prompt_templates.scenario: Wrap React component with error handling
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an ErrorBoundary component in React that catches JavaScript errors, displays a fallback UI, and reports errors to console.

prompt_templates.title: Complete error flow
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement a complete error handling flow: backend exception, FastAPI handler, API response, frontend ApiClient error parsing, and user toast notification.

output_examples.input: Create a custom exception for when a student cannot be found
output: StudentNotFoundError extends NotFoundError with 404 status code
User message: Student not found. Please check and try again.
Internal detail: Student with id '12345' not found
Logged with correlation ID for request tracing

best_practices: Use narrow try-catch blocks that only catch specific expected exceptions
Always log exceptions with sufficient context but never include PII
Return different error formats for internal debugging versus user display
anti_patterns: Catching Exception or bare except: clause that swallows all errors
Logging sensitive data like passwords, tokens, or user personal information
Returning raw exception messages to users that expose internal implementation details

faq.question: Which Python frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill focuses on FastAPI but patterns work with any Python ASGI framework like Starlette.

faq.question: What is the maximum number of custom exceptions supported?
faq.answer: There is no hard limit. Create as many exception classes as needed for your domain model.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing authentication?
faq.answer: Use the UnauthorizedError and ForbiddenError classes in your auth middleware to return proper 401/403 responses.

faq.question: Does this skill send error data to external services?
faq.answer: No. The logging outputs to configured log handlers which you control separately.

faq.question: Why are my error messages not reaching the frontend?
faq.answer: Check that your exception handler returns JSONResponse with content containing the error object structure.

faq.question: How does this compare to Sentry or other error tracking tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides patterns for structured error responses. Use Sentry or similar tools separately for aggregation and alerting.
